+
===Fulham===
  +
In December 2006, [[Fulham F.C.|Fulham]] offered MLS a $4 million [[transfer fee]] for Dempsey, then the largest amount ever offered for an MLS player.<ref>{{cite news|author=Frank Dell'Apa|url=http://soccernet.espn.go.com/columns/story?id=398831&root=mls&cc=5901|title=Dempsey could set the tone for future MLS transfers| publisher=[[ESPNsoccernet]]|date=January 7, 2007|accessdate=2007-07-07}}</ref><ref>{{cite news|author=Frank Dell'Apa|url=http://www.boston.com/sports/soccer/articles/2007/02/27/transfer_of_power_for_revolution/|title=Transfer of power for Revolution| publisher=[[The Boston Globe]]|date=February 27, 2007|accessdate=2007-07-07}}</ref> The league agreed to the transfer; however, Dempsey still needed to receive a work permit from the [[Home Office|United Kingdom Home Office]]. On January 10, 2007, the Home Office granted Dempsey the work permit, thus allowing him to play in England.<ref>{{cite news|author=New England Soccer|url=http://www.soccer-new-england.com/Dempsey-Work-Permit-Approved.html|title=Dempsey work permit approved| work=Soccer New England|date=January 10, 2007|accessdate=2007-01-10}}</ref>
  +   +
Dempsey made his first appearance for Fulham shortly thereafter, coming on as a late substitute in Fulham's match against [[Tottenham Hotspur F.C.|Tottenham Hotspur]] on January 20, 2007.<ref> {{cite web|title=Tactical Formation|work=Football-Lineups.com
  +
|url=http://www.football-lineups.com/match/3474/ | accessdate=2008-01-25}}</ref> However, for the remainder of the spring of 2007 Dempsey was used only sparingly by a relegation-threatened Fulham. On May 5, 2007, Dempsey scored his first and only goal of the [[2006-07 in English football|2006-07]] season for Fulham after coming on as a 54th minute substitute against [[Liverpool F.C.|Liverpool]], in a vital match which Fulham won 1-0. The goal ensured Fulham's top flight status for the [[2007-08 in English football|2007-08]] season.<ref name='ffc_liverpool_200607'>{{cite web|url=http://www.fulhamfc.com/MatchAndTeam/MatchCentre/Matches/0607/Premiership/LiverpoolHome.aspx
  +
|title= Fulham 1-0 Liverpool|accessdate=2007-05-11|publisher=[[Fulham Football Club]]
  +
}}</ref><ref name='ffc_golden_goal'>{{cite web|url=http://www.fulhamfc.com/Club/News/NewsArticles/2007/May/DempseyGoal.aspx|date=2007-05-08|title=Dempsey's Golden Goal|accessdate=2007-05-11|publisher=[[Fulham Football Club]]}}</ref>
  +   +
Dempsey was a key part of the starting squad for Fulham during the [[Premier League 2007-08|2007-08 Premier League season]]. His six goals, all scored in the Premier League, made him Fulham's top scorer in league play and tied for the club lead in all competitions. In May 2008, Dempsey received an automatic contract extension from Fulham that will keep him at the club through 2010.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://podcast.ussoccer.com/05-07-08ClintDempsey.mp3|date=2008-05-07|title=Podcast Interview with Clint Dempsey|accessdate=2008-05-09|publisher=U.S. Soccer}}</ref>
  +   +
Dempsey scored his first goal on the 2008-2009 campaign on October 26, 2008, against [[Portsmouth F.C.|Portsmouth]]. Coming on as a 70th-minute sub, Demspey volleyed home an [[Erik Nevland]] cross past [[David James]] to tie the game at 1-1. On December 28, 2008, Dempsey started in the [[West London derby|SW6 Derby]] against Chelsea and scored both goals for Fulham, one a chest and flick past [[Petr Äech]] that put Fulham ahead, and the other an 89th-minute equalizing header off a [[Simon Davies (footballer born 1979)|Simon Davies]] corner.<ref>{{cite web| url=http://news.bbc.co.uk/sport1/hi/football/eng_prem/7788414.stm| title=Fulham 2-2 Chelsea| publisher=BBC Sport| last=Stevenson| first=Jonathan| date=2009-04-12| accessdate=2009-04-12}}</ref> On April 12, 2009, Dempsey was voted [[Man of the Match]] in a 3-1 win over [[Manchester City F.C.|Manchester City]] at [[City of Manchester Stadium|Eastlands]], in which he scored two goals.<ref>{{cite web| url=http://news.bbc.co.uk/sport1/hi/football/eng_prem/7978876.stm| title=Man City 1-3 Fulham| publisher=BBC Sport| last=Bevan| first=Chris| date=2009-04-12| accessdate=2009-04-12}}</ref>
  +   +
On August 13, 2009, Dempsey signed a contract extension to remain with Fulham through 2013.<ref>{{Citation |title=Dempsey Signs Extension |url=http://www.fulhamfc.com/Club/News/NewsArticles/2009/August/DempseyExtension.aspx |publisher=Fulham F.C. |date=2009-08-13 |accessdate=2009-08-13}}</ref> On August 20, 2009, he scored his first goal in European competition, in the newly formed [[UEFA Europa League|Europa League]], netting Fulham's second goal in a 3–1 win against [[FC Amkar Perm|Amkar Perm]] in the [[2009â10 UEFA Europa League qualifying phase and play-off round#Play-off round|play-off]] round.<ref>{{Citation |title= Fulham 3-1 Amkar Perm |url=http://news.bbc.co.uk/sport1/hi/football/europe/8209325.stm |publisher=BBC Sport |date=2009-08-20 |accessdate=2009-08-20}}</ref>
